headline.title: Get Started
textblock: If you are looking for information on how to join us, you are in the right place. Read on to find out how you can get involved and contribute to Corona-Warn-App code and documentation. Let's get started!

headline.title: Contribution
headline.text: Anyone can become a member of the project’s community. We encourage everyone interested to contribute and become part of our developer community. There are many different ways for you to get involved.

simple-list.title: Contribution rules
list: All members of the project community must abide by the Contributor Covenant, version 2.0.
Only by respecting each other can we develop a productive, collaborative community.
For more guidelines, read the Code of Conduct.

headline.title: Get involved
headline.sub-headline: You can submit a pull request in GitHub

content.sub-headline: If you are contributing for the first time, follow the steps:

feature-list.title: To work on an issue
feature-list.text: claim it first by commenting on the GitHub issue that you want to work on.

feature-list.title: To ask a question
feature-list.text: about one of the issues - comment on them, and one of the maintainers will clarify.

feature-list.title: To contribute code
feature-list.text: in order to fix a bug or to implement a new feature - contributions must be licensed under the Apache 2.0 License.

feature-list.title: To contribute documentation
feature-list.text: under the same license as code, the Apache 2.0 License.

feature-list.title: To report a trivial fix or improvement
feature-list.text: claim it first by commenting on the GitHub issue that you want to work on.

section-contribute-listing.text: For any of the above make sure you provide as much info as you can. Follow the instructions here.

content.title: You are welcome to get involved even more!
content.text: In that case reach out to us and send an email. We’re happy to see new ideas coming in.
